qas.question: What capital of France was lost to the Nazi Germans?
When did the Soviet army initiate their blockade on Estonia?
What was the name of the Finnish aeroplane attacked by the Soviets?
Where was the destination of Kaleva?

context: On <a1_0>14 June<a1_0/>, while the world's attention was focused on the fall of <a0_0>Paris<a0_0/> to Nazi Germany a day earlier, the Soviet military blockade on Estonia went into effect, two Soviet bombers downed the Finnish passenger aeroplane "<a2_0>Kaleva<a2_0/>" flying from Tallinn to <a3_0>Helsinki<a3_0/> carrying three diplomatic pouches from the US delegations in Tallinn, Riga and Helsinki. On 16 June, the Soviet Union invaded Estonia. The Red Army exited from their military bases in Estonia on 17 June. The following day, some 90,000 additional troops entered the country. In the face of overwhelming Soviet force, the Estonian government capitulated on 17 June 1940 to avoid bloodshed.
